definitions: (of a person's steps) feeble or unsteady

examples.text: she swayed on her feet and took a few tottering steps

definitions: (of a structure) shaking or swaying as if about to collapse

examples.text: all that was left of this historic building were sections of tottering, smoke-blackened walls

shortDefinitions: shaking as if about to collapse

definitions: (of a system, organization, process, etc.) insecure or on the point of failure

examples.text: deflation can weaken an already tottering economy in three ways
